title: Relates to prohibiting funding of terrorist activities through donations to not-for-profit organizations

       Introduced by M. of A. CASTELLI -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the penal law and the not-for-profit corporation law, in
         relation  to  prohibiting  funding and support of terrorist activities
         and organizations

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.   Section 490.15 of the penal law, as added by chapter 300
    2  of the laws of 2001, is amended to read as follows:
    3  S 490.15 Soliciting or providing support for an act of terrorism in  the
    4             first degree.
    5    A person commits soliciting or providing support for an act of terror-
    6  ism in the first degree when:
    7    1.  he or she commits the crime of soliciting or providing support for
    8  an act of terrorism in the second degree and the total value of material
    9  support or resources exceeds one thousand dollars; OR
   10    2. HE OR SHE, AS AN OFFICER OR DIRECTOR  OF  A  NOT-FOR-PROFIT  CORPO-
   11  RATION,  KNOWINGLY  PERMITS  SUCH CORPORATION TO ASSIST, FUND OR SUPPORT
   12  TERRORISM.
   13    Soliciting or providing support for an act of terrorism in  the  first
   14  degree is a class C felony.
   15    S  2.  Section  115 of the not-for-profit corporation law, as added by
   16  chapter 669 of the laws of 1977, is amended to read as follows:
   17  S 115. Power to solicit contributions for charitable purposes.
   18    (A) SOLICITATION OF CONTRIBUTIONS FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES.  No  corpo-
   19  ration having the power to solicit contributions for charitable purposes
   20  may  solicit  contributions  for  any purpose for which approval of such
   21  solicitation is required under the provisions of  section  four  hundred
   22  four of this chapter unless the certificate specifically makes provision
   23  for  such  solicitation and the required written approval is endorsed on

    1  or annexed to such certificate or unless the corporation is among  those
    2  referred  to  in section one hundred seventy-two-a of the executive law.
    3  If such approval is not obtained and the corporation continues to solic-
    4  it  or  to  receive contributions for such purpose or advertises that it
    5  has obtained such approval, the attorney general, at the request of  the
    6  officer  or  body  authorized  to grant such approval, shall maintain an
    7  action or proceeding pursuant to the provisions of subparagraph  one  of
    8  paragraph  (a)  of section one hundred twelve of this [chapter] ARTICLE.
    9  Such an action may also be maintained in relation to a corporation here-
   10  inafter incorporated if the name, purposes, objects or the activities of
   11  such corporation may, in any manner, lead to the belief that the  corpo-
   12  ration possesses or may exercise any of such purposes.
   13    (B) CONTRIBUTIONS SOLICITED FOR, OR TRANSFERRED TO, ORGANIZATIONS THAT
   14  SUPPORT  TERRORISM  PROHIBITED. NO CORPORATION FORMED UNDER THIS CHAPTER
   15  SHALL SOLICIT CONTRIBUTIONS FOR, OR TRANSFER ANY MONIES TO,  ANY  PERSON
   16  OR  ORGANIZATION WHICH ASSISTS, FUNDS OR SUPPORTS TERRORISM OR TERRORIST
   17  ACTIVITIES. TERRORISM AND TERRORIST ACTIVITIES FOR THE PURPOSES OF  THIS
   18  SECTION,  SHALL  INCLUDE  ANY  ACT,  OR  THREAT  OF  AN ACT, OF VIOLENCE
   19  DIRECTED AGAINST THE UNITED STATES, ANY STATE, OR LOCAL  GOVERNMENT,  OR
   20  AGAINST ANY PERSON OR PROPERTY WITHIN THE UNITED STATES, IF SUCH ACT, OR
   21  THREAT  OF  AN  ACT,  OF VIOLENCE IS MOTIVATED BY RELIGIOUS, CULTURAL OR
   22  POLITICAL IDEOLOGY. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS  SECTION,  THE  ASSISTANCE,
   23  FUNDING  OR  SUPPORT OF TERRORISM SHALL INCLUDE ANY ACTIVITY WHICH COULD
   24  ASSIST THE ADVANCEMENT, PLANNING,  OPERATION,  CONDUCT  OR  ADVOCACY  OF
   25  TERRORISM  OR TERRORIST ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING THE ASSISTANCE, FUNDING OR
   26  SUPPORTING OF ANY EDUCATIONAL, RELIGIOUS, CULTURAL OR  POLITICAL  ORGAN-
   27  IZATION,  OR  PERSON OFFICIALLY AFFILIATED WITH SUCH ORGANIZATION, WHICH
   28  ADVOCATES THE ADVANCEMENT, PLANNING, OPERATION, CONDUCT OR  ADVOCACY  OF
   29  TERRORISM OR TERRORIST ACTIVITIES. THE ATTORNEY GENERAL AND/OR THE STATE
   30  COMPTROLLER,  UPON  PROBABLE CAUSE, MAY AUDIT AND INVESTIGATE ANY CORPO-
   31  RATION FORMED UNDER THIS CHAPTER, SUSPECTED OF VIOLATING THE  PROVISIONS
   32  OF  THIS SECTION.   UPON THE CONDUCT OF SUCH AUDIT OR INVESTIGATION, THE
   33  ATTORNEY GENERAL AND STATE COMPTROLLER SHALL BE PERMITTED FULL AND UNRE-
   34  STRICTED ACCESS TO ALL RECORDS, PAPERS AND ACCOUNTS OF SUCH CORPORATION,
   35  AND SHALL ALSO BE EMPOWERED TO DEPOSE UNDER OATH, ANY OFFICER,  DIRECTOR
   36  OR  EMPLOYEE  OF  SUCH CORPORATION. THE ATTORNEY GENERAL SHALL ALSO HAVE
   37  THE POWER, AS SHALL THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY OF THE  COUNTY  IN  WHICH  THE
   38  CORPORATION  MAINTAINS  ITS  OFFICES, TO PROSECUTE ANY VIOLATION OF THIS
   39  SECTION.  ANY CORPORATION FOUND TO HAVE VIOLATED THE PROVISIONS OF  THIS
   40  SECTION,  AND/OR  ANY CORPORATION WHICH HAS AN OFFICER OR DIRECTOR FOUND
   41  GUILTY OF SECTION 490.15 OF  THE  PENAL  LAW  UPON  APPLICATION  TO  THE
   42  SUPREME  COURT BY THE ATTORNEY GENERAL OR THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY SHALL BE
   43  DEEMED IMMEDIATELY DISSOLVED, WITH ITS ASSETS IMMEDIATELY TRANSFERRED TO
   44  THE STATE OF NEW YORK, AND THE STATE COMPTROLLER  UPON  DEPOSITING  SUCH
   45  ASSETS INTO A SEGREGATED ACCOUNT SHALL THEREUPON DISBURSE SUCH ASSETS TO
   46  OTHER  CHARITABLE  ORGANIZATIONS  WHICH  DO  NOT ASSIST, FUND OR SUPPORT
   47  TERRORISM OR  TERRORIST  ACTIVITIES,  UNLESS  THE  SUPREME  COURT  FINDS
   48  COMPELLING  EVIDENCE  THAT  THE  CORPORATION'S EXISTENCE SHOULD BE MAIN-
   49  TAINED AND THE CORPORATION HAS DEMONSTRATED THAT ALL PERSONS INVOLVED IN
   50  THE ACTIVITIES CONSTITUTING A VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION HAVE BEEN PERMA-
   51  NENTLY BARRED FROM EMPLOYMENT, ASSOCIATION, AND/OR ANY INVOLVEMENT  WITH
   52  THE CORPORATION.
   53    S 3. This act shall take effect January 1, 2012.
